## ArrayElement type

Extracts the element type from an array type using type inference.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export type ArrayElement<T> = T extends Array<infer U> ? U : never;
```

## Remarks

This type utility uses TypeScript's `infer` keyword to extract the element type from any array-like type. It works with both regular arrays and tuples.

## Example


```ts
type Numbers = ArrayElement<number[]>; // number
type Mixed = ArrayElement<[string, number, boolean]>; // string | number | boolean
type Empty = ArrayElement<[]>; // never
```
